content: - 8 -   stressed, r* and u* are uncertain, and I believe we should continue to update our   estimates of them as new data arrive.  This process of learning about r* and u* as new   data arrive supports the case for gradual policy normalization, as it will allow the Fed to   accumulate more information from the data about the ultimate destination for the policy   rate and the unemployment rate at a time when inflation is close to our 2 percent   objective.
